data.meta_description: Purchase Heaven Can Wait on digital and stream instantly or download offline. Henry Van Cleve (Don Ameche), an aged former playboy, has died and gone to hell. But the ruler of the realm of darkness, His Excellency (Laird Cregar), isn't convinced Van Cleve's come to the right place. Henry proceeds to recount his life story, from his first real stirrings of passion with a French governess, to the wooing and winning of his beautiful wife, Martha (Gene Tierney).

Count German expat Ernst Lubitsch among the directors whose films require a darkened theater and a willing audience to even work -- you just won't get him at home on your flatscreen.

Scripted by Raphaelson, Lubitsch's frequent collaborator, this light, suave comedy of manners (his first in color) displays what's known as the Lubitsch touch, and would have been more successful with a more charismatic actor than Don Ameche.
